bug.short_desc: audacity: Crash at start when run on Gnome Wayland
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Audacity crash at start on Gnome Wayland (XWayland).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): audacity-2.1.2-4.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Just run audacity.
Actual results: Crash.
Expected results: The UI to start.

It works if one force the GDK backend to X11
GDK_BACKEND=x11 audacity
What lines are printed to the terminal during the attempted start when started from a terminal ?
*** Bug 1361791 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to David Timms from comment #2) > What lines are printed to the terminal during the attempted start when > started from a terminal ?
It's boring, sorry ;-P
$ audacity Segmentation fault (core dumped)

It looks like this happens because audacity dlopen()'s libgnome and libgnomeui, which then call X11 functions. Those GNOME 2 calls can probably just be patched out because it seems to work fine even if libgnome and libgnomeui packages aren't installed.
